intro: Cacalia hookkeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's cacalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Argentina and Chile. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow-orange centers, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in cooler, high-altitude environments. Cacalia hookkeriana is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental beauty in horticultural settings.
